name: Robert Manzon
introduction: Robert Manzon, (born 12 April 1917 in Marseille, Bouches-du-Rhne, Provence-Alpes-Cte d'Azur, France  died 19 January 2015 in Cassis, Bouches-du-Rhne, Provence-Alpes-Cte d'Azur, France) was a former French racing driver who spent large amounts of his career racing for the Gordini team. He split from the team one race into the 1953 season when his wheel came off during the race, and joined the Lancia sports car team.
